item.title: Ticket #2851 (Deleting link with apostrophe in title doesn't work) updated
item.dc:creator: disaster77
item.description: Version changed

item.title: Ticket #2851 (Deleting link with apostrophe in title doesn't work) created
item.dc:creator: disaster77
item.description:
Deleting a link with an apostrophe in the title produces a JavaScript error since the apostrophe is not escaped. The link can not be deleted until the title is changed to not have the apostrophe.

Error: missing ) after argument list Source Code: return deleteSomething( 'link', 51 , 'You are about to delete the "Roy's Photo Gallery" bookmark to ​http://.\n"Cancel" to stop, "OK" to delete.' );

item.title: Changeset [3903]: wp_get_current_commenter()

item.description: wp_get_current_commenter()

item.title: Ticket #2850 (Update permalinks not refreshing rewrite_rules in wp_options table) created
item.dc:creator: meckhert
item.description:
When a user changes the post-slug name for a static page, the rewrite_rules are not properly refreshed. Consequently, permalinks for static pages will not work properly if the post-slug name is changed for an existing page. The workaround I used was to manually go into wp_options and delete the value for rewrite_rules and then regenerage the permalink structure using the admin control panel.

I opened a forum thread regarding this issue here:

​http://wordpress.org/support/topic/77070?replies=3

item.title: Ticket #2849 (Need hook for admin-functions.php's dropdown_categories) created
item.dc:creator: ryanscheuermann
item.description:
I'm attempting to use the categories table for auxiliary post_type's, and I'd like to be able to hide those categories from the Write Post admin screen. Can we add a hook for the admin's dropdown_categories function? Or in light of Ryan's category reorg's, should this function be using get_categories or a similar function?

Either way, there are no hooks for the category display on the Write Post screen.

item.title: Ticket #2848 (The RSSCache class should have a "clear" function) created
item.dc:creator: mikelococo
item.description: The RSSCache class defined in wp-includes/rss-functions.php should provide a function to clear the RSS cache. When doing development of plugins, themes, and normal experimentation with new site functionality it is sometimes necessary to test changing feeds. Refreshing the cache manually is preferable to setting a short expiry time.

item.description: When deleting a page from the Edit Page screen, there is no nonce check.

item.title: Ticket #2846 (Failed nonce check with javascript disabled on Edit Post page) created
item.dc:creator: masquerade
item.description:
When editing a draft or a post, a button is available that says "Delete this post". With Javascript disabled, this nonce check will always fail because the nonce code is inserted with javascript. This should peacefully degrade for users without javascript and allow them to delete without seeing the AYS dialogue.

BTW, verified that this behavior is consistent between 2.0 branch and trunk... and it is.

item.title: wp203-longtext.txt attached to Ticket #2845
item.dc:creator: MephistoBS
item.description: Sample text to produce the bug

item.title: Ticket #2845 (WP 2.0.3 cuts long texts in editor after saving) created
item.dc:creator: MephistoBS
item.description:
When writing long texts in the WordPress 2.0.3 editor, the text will be cutted off before the end when saving it. A sample text can be obtained here:

​http://www.q-vadis.net/other/samples/wp203-longtext.txt

How to produce the bug:

  • create a blog posting and pasting the text into the editor field
  • go to manage posts, select the new entry
  • change something in the middle of the text
  • click "save & continue"
  • the text in the editor field is now cutted

At this stage, one can go back to manage -> posts and get the full text again. If saving a second time, the cutted off text is lost, of course.

item.title: Ticket #2844 (No value for sendmail_from, user registration email not sent) created
item.dc:creator: shacker
item.description:
WP installed in cPanel add-on domains do not send welcome messages to new WP users.

Watching the exim_reject_log shows:

F=<> rejected after DATA: there is no valid sender in any header line

...

Envelope-from: <>

...

F From:

phpinfo(); confirms that the sendmail_from property has "no value."

Adding this to .htaccess :

php_value sendmail_from user@…

causes phpinfo() to show a valid value, but attempting to register a new user still shows exim refusing to send the message because there is "no valid sender."

A simple PHP mail test script in the same dir works fine.

item.title: Ticket #2613 (Don't show private posts on front page) updated
item.dc:creator: skeltoac
item.description:
Pendulum action: now some WP.com folks are complaining about their private posts disappearing from the main query.

get_the_title() marks posts that have passwords. This could be done for Private posts. Wouldn't this solve the problem (confusion) without upsetting either camp? (I don't consider the user worried about people using his logged-in computer a camp, sorry gfmorris. Log out.)

item.title: Ticket #2843 (bad regex pattern in wp-includes/vars.php) updated
item.dc:creator: skeltoac
item.description: Sorry, I didn't notice the $. That should have been included.

item.title: Ticket #2843 (bad regex pattern in wp-includes/vars.php) updated
item.dc:creator: herr_ernst
item.description:
Why not also add the "$" for the end of the line like "\.php$"? Would be more foolproof. Very unlikely that somebody has a path like "/web/files.php/wordpress/", but still possible.

But I don't really know what the original author wants to accomplish with the if-else beginning line 4. So I'm not sure if the correction is correct.

item.title: Ticket #2843 (bad regex pattern in wp-includes/vars.php) updated
item.dc:creator: skeltoac
item.description:
Version changed

Nice catch! Good first report!

Unified diffs are always appreciated.

item.title: Ticket #2843 (bad regex pattern in wp-includes/vars.php) updated
item.dc:creator: error
item.description:
Keywords, Priority, Severity, Milestone changed

Yeah, that'll mess up anybody whose pathname includes the string "php". The replacement regex looks OK, too.

item.title: Ticket #2843 (bad regex pattern in wp-includes/vars.php) created
item.dc:creator: herr_ernst
item.description:
wp-includes/vars.php

Line 4-6 is like: 

if (preg_match('#([^/]+.php)#', $PHP_SELF, $self_matches)) {
         $pagenow = $self_matches[1];
}

which should be more like 

if (preg_match('#([^/]+\.php$)#', $PHP_SELF, $self_matches)) {
         $pagenow = $self_matches[1];
 }

because i had "php" in the path, so the variable $pagenow was set wrong and it couldnt find some files

my first bug ever discovered and submitted, so i hope i have not made too many mistakes...
